resources.string: Password generated by Easy Password Manager
At least one Checkbox must be active.

Under this menu item passwords can be created using templates.

Description of the functions:

Password type
This selects the desired template. More information about the different templates are available in the Password Templates section of the help.

Password length
Use this slider to set the desired password length. This slider is only available for templates that allow a variable password length.

Number of passwords
Use this slider to set the number of passwords to create.

Generate
Use this button to generate the passwords with the settings you have made.

If the passwords are generated, you will see the generated passwords in a list. For each password, a rating for its strength is displayed. A green rating means strong, a yellow medium, and a red weak. In addition, a password can be copied to the clipboard via the respective button.

Under this menu item custom passwords can be created.

Description of the functions:

Leading Characters / Trailing Characters
Leading / Trailing Characters will be generated at the beginning / end of the password. For these you can use the checkboxes to configure which characters can occur and with the slider u can configure how many leading / trailing characters will be in the password. If you set the number of leading / trailing characters to 0 or deactivate all characters no leading / trailing characters will occur in the password.

Main Characters
The main characters will build the main part of the generated password. For this part the checkboxes can be used to configure which characters can occur. At least one checkbox has to be active. The length of the main part will be determined indirectly via the password length.

Speaking Password
You can activate this function via the Speaking Password checkbox. For this option to be available, at least one area (Leading Characters, Main Characters, Trailing Characters) must consist of letters only.
This feature ensures that in sections that are containing only of letters a pronounceable password will be generated. Pronounceable means that a vowel and a consonant will be generated alternately.

Avoid similar characters
If this checkbox is active the generated password will not contain similar looking characters like 1 and l, O and 0, etc.

Password length
Use this slider to set the desired password length. The minimum length of the password will always be length of the leading / trailing characters + 1.

Number of passwords
Use this slider to set the number of passwords to create.

Generate
Use this button to generate the passwords with the settings you have made.

If the passwords are generated, you will see the generated passwords in a list. For each password, a rating for its strength is displayed. A green rating means strong, a yellow medium, and a red weak. In addition, a password can be copied to the clipboard via the respective button.
This menu items contains the help of the app.
This menu item contains some meta information about this app, e.g. the author, a contact e-mail address, version information, etc.

Use this template to create memorable passwords.

It is possible to set the password length for this template. The generated passwords will consist of a capital letter followed by lowercase letters and three digits at the end. Furthermore the password is talking - this means, that the password consists alternately of a vowel and a consonant.

Use this template to create complex passwords.

It is possible to set the password length for this template. The generated passwords will consist of upper- and lowercase letters, digits and special characters.

Use this template to create WEP-Keys.

It is not possible to set the password length. The generated passwords can be used for WEP encryption.

Use this template to create WPA2-Keys.

It is not possible to set the password length. The generated passwords can be used for WPA2 encryption.
If you enjoy using this app, would you mind taking a moment to rate it? It won\'t take more than a minute. Thank you for your support!
